oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes a laboratory curriculum for a semester forensic chemistry survey course. Students are instructed in drug chemistry, toxicology, explosives analysis, arson examination, pattern evidence, and trace evidence analysis. Each week, students are instructed on a new method, instrument, or technique using known standards and unknown compounds or materials. Student writeups include a short abstract, lab notebook pages, data table(s), graph(s), and chart(s). A simulated case and capstone lab is included. Learning how the instruments work, how to apply them to the analysis of physical evidence, and concise reporting of data and findings is the focus of this course, and a description of the instructor’s curriculum modules and weekly activities is the focus of this paper.
